data.title: Better Than Chain Coffee Ships
data.text: The difference between Central Perk and Starbucks/Caribou/Dunn Bros. is personal service. The coffee products are all similar. I had the mocha espresso, vehicle was delicious!  The food/sandwich menu is more extensive than the "chains". The owner was the only one working when I was here. He is very friendly and knowledgeable regarding coffee products. They also serve Bridgeman's Ice Cream!  Support this local coffee shop!

data.title: Not Good for Vegetarians
data.text: I don't come here because I typically love coffee shop food, being vegetarian, but they don't have any sauce on any of their vegetarian options here so it is super dry! Avocado is not a substitute for a sauce... They just aren't very inventive with their vegetarian sandwiches either so even when I have added a sauce, it was blasé.

data.title: Comfortable stop in St. Cloud
data.text: My co-worker and I were visiting St. Cloud State University to give a lecture.  Since we arrived early, we decided to head downtown for a cup of coffee.  As we were both fans of the tv show Friends, we decided to stop at Central Perk.  The coffee was solid and breakfast and lunch were both available.  Seating was very comfortable and there was free wi-fi.  I would stop again.

data.title: Lunch after VA appointment
data.text: My wife likes to join me when I travel to the VA center in St Cloud, we usually have lunch and/or explore the area. Today we had lunch at Central Perk Coffee Shop. I guess we know that they watched Friends. The food menu had a lot to choose from,  and the coffee choices were immense. Lots of imagination. We both had the Regency sandwich, turkey, avocado,sprouts, provolone cheese and more, I had mine on multigrain, my wife had wild rice/cranberry bread. Delicious. The owner and staff were really friendly and attentive. Hot chocolate was perfect on a cold day. Highly recommend

data.title: Don't miss this place!
data.text: Every time we find ourselves in St. Cloud, we make sure there's time to get coffee here. It's a cozy place, with gourmet coffee/teas and an actual grill for hot sandwiches, not your typical coffeehouse food. I've had the chocolate cinnamon tea latte, the Cafe Miel and a delightful Lavender White Chocolate Scone, just to name a few menu items. You can feel good about investing your hard earned cash here because you are not only getting to taste fantastic flavors, but you are supporting a local business. If you are a fan of the show "Friends" then you have to stop here and get "the Rachel" sandwhich. You won't regret it!

data.title: Great Coffee
data.text: This place is a great stop if your looking for a awesome cup of coffee or maybe even some sweets. They offer many different styles and all are good.

data.title: Cute, little place.
data.text: I love it! I like the coffee and cinnamon strudel muffin. It's always clean and service is friendly. Little mom & pop shops need our patronage people! These places are the essence of America (plus coffee; win-win)

data.title: Great stop before Paramount performances
data.text: Located across the street from the Paramount Theater...  like to arrive an hour early for performances to find convenient parking then stop in for a glass or two of wine and a sandwich before the show.   Serves pastries, coffee, wine, and some great sandwiches.

data.title: Great service
data.text: Excellent service, was given a free medium latte for liking a post on their Facebook page. The man working (the owner I believe) was extremely friendly.

data.title: Disappointing Coffee and Food
data.text:
Very disappointed.

Nice atmosphere with couches and all, but the coffee was weak and watery.
Had the waffles for brkfast. They were cardboard-like and the syrup was 100% artificial.
Wish St Cloud had better coffee shops.
